'''Pignite''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''チャオブー''' ''Chaoboo'') is a dual-type {{2t|Fire|Fighting}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s from {{p|Tepig}} starting at [[level]] 17 and evolves into {{p|Emboar}} starting at level 36.

==Biology==
Pignite is a bipedal, pig-like Pokémon. Its chubby body is orange with brown bands around its shoulders, sides, belly, hands, and from the back of its head down its snout. Yellow bands encircle its wrists, and swirled yellow designs bulge from its chest. It has a red pig-like nose, pointed ears, and two pointed teeth that protrude from its lower jaw. Its hands have two claws each, while its feet have only a single nail. Its tail is curled with a tuft of fur at the tip.

Pignite has a fire in its stomach, which it fuels with food. The intensity of this flame increases as fuel is added or when Pignite is angered. As the flame grows stronger, Pignite's speed increases. When in trouble, Pignite emits smoke. Its [[signature move]] is {{m|Heat Crash}}.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ash Pignite.png|250px|thumb|left|Pignite in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Bianca's Emboar|Bianca's Pignite]]====
{{TP|Bianca|Pignite|Emboar}} debuted in ''[[BW013|Minccino-Neat and Tidy!]]'', under the ownership of {{an|Bianca}}. It later evolved into Emboar before ''[[BW071|Search for the Clubultimate!]]''.

====[[Ash's Pignite]]====
{{Ash}}'s Tepig evolved into a {{AP|Pignite}} in ''[[BW077|Evolution by Fire!]]'' while battling his former Trainer, [[Shamus]].

===Minor appearances===
A Pignite appeared in ''[[BW022|A Venipede Stampede!]]'', under the ownership of a Trainer in [[Castelia City]]. This Trainer used a Pignite to try to stop a swarm of {{p|Venipede}}.

A Pignite appeared in a fantasy in ''[[BW070|The Clubsplosion Begins!]]''.

Two Trainers' Pignite appeared in ''[[SM034|A Crowning Moment of Truth!]]'', with one of them appearing in a flashback.

==Trivia==
* Pignite was revealed internationally in the opening ''{{so|Black and White}}''.
* Pignite was a popular fan name given to {{p|Tepig}} before either Pokémon's English name was officially revealed.
* Pignite and its evolutionary {{p|Emboar|relatives}} were created by [[Lee HyunJung]].

===Origin===
[[Ken Sugimori]] has said that Tepig, Pignite, and Emboar were designed in a Chinese style. Because of this, they may be based on {{wp|Zhu Bajie}}, a pig demon from the Chinese tale ''{{wp|Journey to the West}}''. {{p|Infernape}} is also based on a character from the novel, {{wp|Sun Wukong}}, and has a similar design. Pignite looks much like a {{wp|British Saddleback}} or {{wp|wild boar}} in a {{wp|wrestling singlet}}. The swirls on its chest resemble the patterns on a {{wp|Ding (vessel)|ding}} or {{wp|Pottery of ancient Greece|ancient Greek pottery}}.

====Name origin====
Pignite is a combination of ''pig'' and ''ignite''.

Chaoboo may be a combination of 超 ''chāo'' (Chinese for ''super'') or 炒 ''chǎo'' (Chinese for ''{{wp|stir frying}}'') and 豚 ''buta'' (pig) or ブー ''bū'' (oink).
